Title: Temple and Half-Mountain
Description: A Buddhist temple occupies one half of a mountain, while the other has been carved away by heavy machinery mining for jade, in Hpakant, Kachin State.

Title: Climate Crisis Solutions: Collecting Drinking Water in Kalabogi
Description: A woman draws drinking water from a cloth set out to catch rainwater, in the village of Kalabogi, in the Sundarbans mangrove forest, Bay of Bengal, Bangladesh, on 27 September.

Title: Injured Man After Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: An injured man stands near the site of a massive explosion in the port of Beirut, Lebanon, while firefighters work to put out the fires that engulfed the warehouses after the explosion.
Prize Level: World Press Photo of the Year Nominee

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: A howler monkey (Alouatta) is left carbonized by a forest fire that swept through the Santa Tereza farm, in the Paraguay River area of the Pantanal, in the state of Mato Grosso do Sul. The fires in the region were so intense that not even the fastest animals were able to escape the flames.

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: IBAMA firefighters are transported to combat a forest fire at the Santa Tereza farm.

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: Firefighters combat a fire outbreak at the São Francisco de Perigara farm, which is home to one of the largest populations of Hyacinth macaws (Anodorhynchus hyacinthinus) in Brazil. About 92 percent of the farm area, mostly dedicated to preservation, was destroyed by the fire.

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: Burnt landscape lines the Transpantaneira, a road crossing the Pantanal, near Porto Jofre. The road is known for its wildlife-watching opportunities.

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: A volunteer looks for fire spots under a wooden bridge on the Transpantaneira. The road, which has 120 bridges, most of them made of wood, is the only access to the community of Porto Jofre and to several farms in the Mato Grosso region.

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: A caiman, killed by wildfires, lies alongside the Transpantaneira.

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: Firefighters from the Sesc Porto Cercado hotel's private force sit on top of a water truck as an airplane drops water onto a fire burning near the hotel, in Poconé.

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: Firefighters and volunteers combat a wildfire at Jofre Velho farm, part of the Panthera Institute, a non-governmental organization dedicated to the preservation and research of wild cat species, including jaguars in the Pantanal.

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: A thick layer of ash covers the ground after fire swept through forestland on the Santa Tereza farm in the Paraguay River area of the Pantanal.

Title: Pantanal Ablaze
Description: A dead deer lies in a pasture burned by wildfires in an area of the Pantanal devastated by a wildfire from which even the swiftest of animals could not escape.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: The youth group that built this ice stupa in the village of Gya installed a café in its base. They used the proceeds to take the village elders on a pilgrimage.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: Tsering Angchuk (53), a farmer from the village of Stase-Dho, helped build a 22-meter-high ice stupa for the village.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: Farida Batool, a student at the middle school in the village of Karith, high in the mountains on the Pakistani border, has helped build several ice stupas, together with her fellow students.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: Water spouts from the delivery pipe to form the 24-meter-high stupa in Gangles, near the regional capital, Leh.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: Builders of the Shara Phuktsey stupa celebrate after their 33.5-meter-tall achievement was declared the tallest stupa in Ladakh in 2019. In subzero temperatures, they had to climb the stupa often to fix nozzles that had frozen and stopped spraying water.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: The giant Shara Phuktsey stupa, some 80 kilometers southeast of the regional capital, Leh, stored around 7.5 million liters of water, and helped irrigate fields in four villages. The stupa also drew tourists: ice climbers came to scale its steep flanks.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: Visitors and members of the local community enjoy the ice at the Shara Phuktsey stupa. Although tourism is a major contributor to Ladakh’s cash economy, it exacerbates the water shortage. According to studies carried out by the Ladakh Ecological Development and Environmental Group, an average Ladakhi uses about 20 liters of water a day, compared to 75 liters used by tourists.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: A member of the Shara Phuktsey team stands on the 33.5-meter-tall stupa he helped to construct.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: A stupa-building team from the village of Shara Phuktsey stands in front of the 33.5-meter-tall Shara Phuktsey ice stupa, which won a US$ 6,800 prize in 2019 for being the highest in Ladakh.

Title: One Way to Fight Climate Change: Make Your Own Glaciers
Description: A lone figure stands before the prize-winning 33.5-meter-tall Shara Phuktsey ice stupa, the highest in Ladakh in 2019.

Title: The First Embrace
Description: Rosa Luzia Lunardi (85) is embraced by nurse Adriana Silva da Costa Souza, at Viva Bem care home, São Paulo, Brazil.

Title: The Human Cost of COVID-19
Description: The body of a suspected coronavirus victim, wrapped in yellow infectious-waste plastic, lies awaiting a body bag, in a hospital in Indonesia.

Title: Ceremony to Mourn Qasem Soleimani in Tehran
Description: Women mourn the death of Major General Qasem Soleimani, at a commemoration service in Tehran, Iran.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Anushavan (62) stands in a pomegranate orchard in the yard of his home, in the village of Ukhtasar, Nagorno-Karabakh. He holds a Kalashnikov assault rifle kept from the First Nagorno-Karabakh War.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: A rocket remaining after the shelling of the city of Martuni (Khojavend), Nagorno-Karabakh, lies in a field.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Azat Gevorkyan and his wife Anaik are pictured before leaving their home in Lachin, Nagorno-Karabakh, the final district to be returned to Azerbaijani control following the Second Nagorno-Karabakh War.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Murad Mvrgaryan and his son Vahak carry items from their home before leaving Lachin, Nagorno-Karabakh, the final district to be returned to Azerbaijani control following the November peace agreement.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: A grave in a cemetery in Lachin, Nagorno-Karabakh. Some residents exhumed the remains of relatives and took them to rebury in Armenia, when they left their homes in Nagorno-Karabakh following the November peace agreement.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Abovyan Hasmik (69) cries at the door of her home in the village of Nerkin Sus, Nagorno-Karabakh.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Residents ride down a street in the village of Taghavard, Nagorno-Karabakh. The village was divided between Armenia and Azerbaijan after the November peace agreement.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Areg sits outside a burning house in the village of Karegakh, Nagorno-Karabakh. Some village residents burned their houses before leaving areas that were to return to Azerbaijani control following the November peace agreement.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Hakob Tersyan (60) looks out the window of his house in Lachin, Nagorno-Karabakh.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: A burning house in the Kelbajar region of Nagorno-Karabakh. According to the peace agreement between Armenia and Azerbaijan, the Kelbajar region came under the control of the Azerbaijani authorities. Some residents set fire to their homes before leaving for Armenia.

Title: California Sea Lion Plays with Mask
Description: A curious California sea lion swims towards a face mask at the Breakwater dive site in Monterey, California, USA.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: An animal-rights investigator explores the perimeter of an intensive pig farm in Castilla-La Mancha, in order to gain access to the farm and document the living conditions of the animals.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: Investigators film a fattening enclosure at a pig farm in Castilla-La Mancha. In February 2020, when they first gained access, investigators found decomposing carcasses. Months later, during a second visit, it appeared that the bodies had not been removed.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: The gestation area of a pig farm in Aragon. European Council Directive 2008/120/EC, relating to the minimum welfare standards of raising pigs, allows the placement of sows in individual crates where they remain immobilized during the first four weeks of pregnancy. Gestation crates are generally arranged so as to accommodate hundreds of sows next to each other.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: Sows stand in gestation crates, on a pig farm in Aragon. Sows in such crates remain completely immobilized during the first four weeks of pregnancy. The reason given is that some sows are aggressive during this period and the crates prevent fighting. In October 2020, the European Citizens’ Initiative handed the  European Commission a petition signed by more than 1.5 million citizens, calling for a ban on caged farming.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: A pig suffering from an eye infection at a farm in Castilla-La Mancha. Inside the sheds, pigs are exposed to gases such as methane and ammonia, produced by the slurry accumulating under the floor of the enclosures, as well as dust from feed and dry fecal matter.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: A pig lies, apparently dying, in the corridor of the fattening area of a farm in Aragon.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: A sow stands in a farrowing crate in a farm in Castile and León. European Council Directive 2008/120/EC, relating to welfare standards on raising pigs, allows breeding sows to be kept in such crates until the end of their lactation period, which ranges from 21 to 28 days. The use of such crates is intended to stop the crushing of piglets.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: Sows stand in farrowing crates at a farm in Castile and León. Piglets are weaned after 21 to 28 days.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: A pig suffering from a neck abscess, at a farm in Castilla-La Mancha. Abscesses—caused by bacteria entering the body through skin lesions—and hernias are among the most striking physical abnormalities that can affect the health of pigs in intensive farms.

Title: Inside the Spanish Pork Industry: The Pig Factory of Europe
Description: Dead pigs lie in a container on a farm in Castilla-La Mancha. According to RENGRATI, a Spanish government research project, sow mortality on farms ranges from 5.4 percent to 10 percent, and that of non-weaned piglets from 10.6 percent to 16.5 percent.

Title: The Aftermath of the North East Delhi Riots
Description: This project depicts properties in the Shiv Vihar quarter of North East Delhi, India, on 3 March, a few days after sectarian riots in the district. India’s National Register of Citizens (NRC), a register containing names of all ‘genuine’ Indian citizens, was first prepared in 1951 to deal with issues regarding illegal migrants in the border state of Assam. In 2019, the ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) proposed that the register be extended to cover the whole of India, and on 12 December 2019, parliament passed a Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) to this effect. The new law allowed Hindus and other non-Muslims in Assam who were unable to prove their citizenship status to be included in the NRC, but left Muslims off the registry. This sparked peaceful protests locally, which spread nationwide. In late February 2020, protests turned to rioting in areas of North East Delhi, in what became the worst sectarian violence in the Indian capital in decades. At least 53 people, mostly Muslims, were killed and property was destroyed.

Title: The Aftermath of the North East Delhi Riots

Title: The Aftermath of the North East Delhi Riots
Description: Not Specified

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: A Swiss-German couple meets at the closed border on Lettackerweg, in Riehen, Switzerland.

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: Two lovers have made themselves as comfortable as possible under the barrier tape at the border between the German town of Lörrach and the Swiss municipality of Riehen. When couples get too close, the patrolling border guards often turn a blind eye.

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: To prevent lovers from touching each other, Swiss border guards erected a second border fence between Kreuzlingen, in Switzerland, and Konstanz in Germany—but that doesn't stop couples from talking through the fence.

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: Friends and lovers meet at the barrier tape marking the closed border between Switzerland and Germany, near Riehen, Switzerland. Every now and then a helicopter flies by to check from the air whether people are abiding by the rules.

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: Josephina from Arbon in Switzerland and Josef from Singen am Hohentwiel in Germany have been a couple for 30 years. Now the lovers meet three times a week at the closed border between Kreuzlingen, in Switzerland, and Konstanz in Germany to at least be able to see each other.

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: Sabrina from Basel in Switzerland and Davor from Wiesbaden in Germany lie on a blanket they have divided with a black line, placed under a border tape in Riehen, Switzerland.

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: Katarina from Frauenfeld in Switzerland and Ivo from Konstanz in Germany met a few months earlier, on last New Year's Eve, in Zagreb, Croatia. Katarina works in real estate management, and Ivo is studying in Konstanz. Now they can only meet once a week, at the closed border between Kreuzlingen, in Switzerland, and Konstanz.

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: Leonie (in the white top) stands on the Swiss side of the border and talks over a fence to her friend Janina on the German side, near Kreuzlingen, Switzerland.

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: A separated family meets at the barrier tape marking the closed Swiss-German border, near Riehen, Switzerland.

Title: Cross-Border Love
Description: Three friends, Sergio, Sami and David, meet for the first time since the outbreak of the pandemic, in a sunny meadow near Riehen, Switzerland.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: A film crew shoots the second part of The Old Beyberikeen With Five Cows, which is based on an old folktale, in Sakha, Russian Federation. The first part of the film, directed by Konstantin Timofeev, was a top-ten box-office hit earlier in 2019.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: Twins Semyon and Stepan perform in the roles of dulgancha, mythical swamp creatures, in The Old Beyberikeen With Five Cows, in Sakha, Russian Federation. It is their first part in a film.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: Isabella Nikolaeva, renowned in Sakha for her theater roles, prepares to appear in the historical comedy Hurried, based on the classic drama by Yakut writer Nikolai Neustroev, in Sakha, Russian Federation.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: Stepan Petrov (left) drinks cognac at home with screenwriter Semyon Ermolaev (middle) and director Eduard Novikov (right), in Sakha, Russian Federation. Their feature film The Lord Eagle—a story about an old man and his wife, who sheltered an eagle, a sacred bird in the Yakut culture—won the Grand Prix at the Moscow International Film Festival in 2018.  Petrov is not a professional actor, but plays in the folk theater of the small village Kerdem, where he lives with his wife.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: Director Stepan Burnashev (right) rehearses lead actor Fedot Lvov in Khara Khaar (Black Snow), a drama about life in the North, how relationships deteriorate due to constant competition and the desire to earn more money, and the problems of modern society, in Sakha, Russian Federation.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: Actor Vasily Sleptsov vapes during breaks between takes of the mystical horror film, The Cursed Land. The film explores the complicated relationship between nature, community and the souls of distant ancestors, in Sakha, Russian Federation.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: Grigory Zamyatin, a hunter, watches a movie on his laptop in his tent, before going to sleep, in Sakha, Russian Federation.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: A movie crew shoots a scene for The Old Beyberikeen With Five Cows, in which the leading characters do battle with an abaasy, a destructive ancestral spirit, in Sakha, Russian Federation.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: Actor Afanasy Karamzin shots a scene for the mystical horror film, The Cursed Land, in Sakha, Russian Federation.

Title: Sakhawood
Description: Residents of the village of Magaras, who participated as extras in the mystical drama The Cursed Land, pose for a group photo, in Sakha, Russian Federation.

Title: Resting Soldier
Description: A soldier lies in a trench, resting on a plastic cover, in the northeastern part of Syunik, Nerkin Khndzoresk, Armenia.

Title: Doctor Peyo and Mister Hassen
Description: Marion (24), who has metastatic cancer, embraces her son Ethan (7) in the presence of Peyo, a horse used in animal-assisted therapy, in the Séléne Palliative Care Unit at the Centre Hospitalier de Calais, in Calais, France.

Title: Yemen: Hunger, Another War Wound
Description: Fatima and her son prepare a fishing net on a boat in Khor Omeira bay, Yemen.

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Anushavan (62) stands in a pomegranate orchard in the yard of his home, in the village of Ukhtasar, Nagorno-Karabakh. He holds a Kalashnikov assault rifle kept from the First Nagorno-Karabakh War.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: A rocket remaining after the shelling of the city of Martuni (Khojavend), Nagorno-Karabakh, lies in a field, on 10 November, the day the peace agreement between Armenia and Azerbaijan came into effect.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Azat Gevorkyan and his wife Anaik are pictured before leaving their home in Lachin, Nagorno-Karabakh, the final district to be returned to Azerbaijani control following the Second Nagorno-Karabakh War.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Murad Mvrgaryan and his son Vahak carry items from their home before leaving the town of Lachin, Nagorno-Karabakh.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: A grave in a cemetery in Lachin, Nagorno-Karabakh. Some residents exhumed the remains of relatives and took them to rebury in Armenia, when they left their homes in Nagorno-Karabakh following the November peace agreement.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Abovyan Hasmik (69) cries at the door of her home in the village of Nerkin Sus, Nagorno-Karabakh.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Residents ride down a street in the village of Taghavard, Nagorno-Karabakh. The village was divided between Armenia and Azerbaijan after the November peace agreement.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Areg sits outside a burning house in the village of Karegakh, Nagorno-Karabakh. Some village residents burned their houses before leaving areas that were to return to Azerbaijani control following the November peace agreement.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: Hakob Tersyan (60) looks out the window of his house in Lachin, Nagorno-Karabakh.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Paradise Lost
Description: A burning house in the Kelbajar region of Nagorno-Karabakh. According to the peace agreement between Armenia and Azerbaijan, the Kelbajar region came under the control of the Azerbaijani authorities. Some residents set fire to their homes before leaving for Armenia.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Flint Jaguars player Dana Homes high-fives one of his coaches as he leaves the locker room for warm-up.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: A basketball net supported by cinder blocks stands beside a street in Flint. The board reads ‘FDT’, an acronym based on a popular anti-Donald Trump protest song.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Jaguars junior Dion Brown sits with his girlfriend Lakenya Thomas as they watch a junior varsity game in a nearly empty gym.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Jaguars player Dana Homes cleans snow off his parents’ car after basketball practice, before going to pick up a teammate to watch the National Basketball Association all-star game.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Jaguars star player Taevion Rushing cuts to the basket for a layup, at a game between the Flint Jaguars and the Bentley Bulldogs from Burton, Michigan, Flint Southwestern High.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Jaguars player D'Angelo Mays plays with a basketball in his bedroom at home.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: The gym at former basketball powerhouse Flint Central High School stands derelict, eight years after the school permanently closed. The American flag and the team banners, both covered in mold, can still be seen in the rafters.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Flint basketball legend Charlie Bell shows off his ‘Flint’ tattoo outside his old high school, Flint Southwestern. Bell was one of the three ‘Flintstones’, who helped lead the Michigan State Spartans to a national championship in 2000. He has returned to Flint to coach a local semi-professional team.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Taevion Rushing sits at home with his grandparents in Flint. Tae spends hours arguing with his grandfather about basketball. His grandparents are keen basketball fans and always have constructive critique for Tae after his games.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Flint Jaguars team star Taevion Rushing jumps from one locker to another in the team locker room before the last regular season game of his high school basketball career. He aims to go on to play basketball at a junior college.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: Nael al-Barghouthi’s suit remains hanging in his bedroom in Kobar, near Ramallah, Palestine. Al-Barghouthi’s wife, Iman Nafi, keeps all her husband’s clothes and belongings in place. Al-Barghouthi was arrested in 1978 after an anti-Israel commando operation. He was released in 2011, married Iman Nafi, but re-arrested in 2014 and sentenced to life imprisonment. He has spent more than 40 years in prison—the longest-serving Palestinian inmate in Israeli jails.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: Lydia Rimawi lies on her sofa in Beit Rima, near Ramallah, Palestine, in December 2018. Her husband Abdul Karim Rimawi was arrested in 2001 and sentenced to 25 years in prison for involvement in the assassination of Israeli tourism minister Rehavam Ze’evi. The couple have a son, Majd, who was born as a result of IVF in 2013. In 2014, Abdul Karim was fined around US$1,500 for smuggling his semen from prison, and deprived of family visits for two months.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: A portrait of Atta Abdelgami hangs in his house in Tulkarm, Palestine. Abdelgami is serving a life sentence. He and his wife Rula Ali Ahmed have two children who were conceived using IVF.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: A separation barrier divides the Pisgat Zeev Israeli Settlement (left) from the Shuafat Refugee Camp, near Jerusalem. Palestinians complain of a feeling of being perpetually trapped behind the barrier, as if they lived in a large open-air prison.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: Wives, mothers, and children of Palestinian prisoners reach a checkpoint in Beit Seira, Palestine. Many face long journeys in order to cross into Israel to visit their relatives in prison. Some have to travel on journeys lasting many hours to get to the prison for a 45-minute visit.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: A chocolate bar conceals a pen case, a favored method of smuggling semen out of prison.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: Remah Bauod, whose husband is serving a life sentence, lies beside her newborn daughter Racha, conceived following IVF, at the Razan Center for Infertility, in Nablus, Palestine, in January 2015.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: A baby born a few hours earlier lies inside an incubator at Al-Shifa Hospital, Gaza, in January 2015.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: Amma Elian, whose husband has been serving a life-sentence since 2003, sits with twins born following IVF, in Tulkarm, Palestine, in January 2015.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Habibi
Description: A love letter sent by long-term prisoner Abdul Karim Rimawi to his wife Lydia.
Prize Level: World Press Photo Story of the Year Nominee

Title: Leaving Home in Nagorno-Karabakh
Description: Azat Gevorkyan and his wife Anaik are pictured before leaving their home in Lachin, Nagorno-Karabakh, the final district to be returned to Azerbaijani control following the Second Nagorno-Karabakh War.
Prize Level: World Press Photo of the Year Nominee

Title: The Transition: Ignat
Description: Ignat, a transgender man, sits with his girlfriend Maria in Saint Petersburg, Russia.
Prize Level: World Press Photo of the Year Nominee

Title: The First Embrace
Description: Rosa Luzia Lunardi (85) is embraced by nurse Adriana Silva da Costa Souza, at Viva Bem care home, São Paulo, Brazil.
Prize Level: World Press Photo of the Year Nominee

Title: Fighting Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: Henry Lenayasa, chief of the settlement of Archers Post, in Samburu County, Kenya, tries to scare away a massive swarm of locusts ravaging grazing area, on 24 April. Locust swarms devastated large areas of land, just as the coronavirus outbreak had begun to disrupt livelihoods.
Prize Level: World Press Photo of the Year Nominee

Title: Islamic State’s Yazidi Survivors
Description: Layla Taloo poses for a portrait at her home in Sharya, Iraq, in the full-face veil and abaya she wore while enslaved for two-and-a-half years by Islamic State militants.

Title: Islamic State’s Yazidi Survivors
Description: Leila Shamo (34) displays tattoos she made while enslaved by Islamic State militants, at her home near Khanke Camp, near Dohuk, Iraq. She used her breast milk, charcoal ash, and a needle to write the name of her husband on the front of her hand, and her two sons and the date they were all captured on the inside of her forearms.

Title: Islamic State’s Yazidi Survivors
Description: A Yazidi woman who endured five years of captivity by Islamic State militants, poses for a portrait in her home in northern Iraq. She says she was raped by nearly a dozen ‘owners’ over years of captivity, and owned by IS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi for months before he ‘gifted’ her to one of his aides. She was freed in a US-led raid in May 2019.

Title: Islamic State’s Yazidi Survivors
Description: Photographs of Yazidis slain in 2014 by Islamic State militants are found in a small room at the Lalish Temple, above the town of Shekhan, in northern Iraq. According to CIJA investigators, when Yazidis were seized, IS registered them, photographed the women and children, categorized women into ‘married’, ‘unmarried’, and ‘girls’, and decided where they would be sent. Initially, the thousands of captured women and children were handed out as gifts to fighters who took part in the Sinjar offensive, in line with IS’s policy on the spoils of war.

Title: Islamic State’s Yazidi Survivors
Description: Layla Taloo directs security forces digging in the garden where she buried her mobile phone and cigarettes while being held in 2014 by Islamic State militants, in Tal Afar, Iraq. Taloo was abducted by IS along with her husband and children, but once her husband was taken away  she was sold to an Iraqi doctor, who three days later gifted her to a friend.

Title: Islamic State’s Yazidi Survivors
Description: Layla Taloo is overcome with grief as her brother, Khalid, leads her away from the compound in Tal Afar, Iraq, where she last saw her husband, when the family was captured by Islamic State militants in 2014.

Title: Islamic State’s Yazidi Survivors
Description: Abdul-Rahman al-Shmary, a 24-year-old Saudi IS member who traded in Yazidi slaves and has been in a Syrian Kurdish-run prison since 2017, is led by guards to an interview in Rmeilan, northeastern Syria.

Title: Islamic State’s Yazidi Survivors
Description: Yazidi youth, dressed in traditional clothes, take part in a program to reacquaint them with their religion and culture at Khanke Camp, near Dohuk, Iraq.

Title: Islamic State’s Yazidi Survivors
Description: Layla Taloo visits the Nineveh Oberoi Hotel in Mosul, Iraq, where she was once brought by her IS captor.

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: The Place de la Concorde, one of Paris’s major squares, lies deserted.

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: Civil protection volunteers Anne-Sophie and Elisabeth check on a homeless man who appears to be sleeping, while doing their rounds in the Second Arrondissement of Paris, France.

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: A man with severe breathing difficulties as a result of a coronavirus infection is taken to hospital, in Bobigny, Paris, France.

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: Healthcare workers treat a COVID patient in the intensive care unit of the Ambroise Paré clinic in  Neuilly-sur-Seine, France. They wear plastic overalls donated by a construction company, as there is a shortage of personal protective equipment (PPE).

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: Farida (47), who works as a carer, helps Madame Meyer (97), in Paris, France. Farida did not want to give up caring for Madame Meyer, even though she was afraid of catching the coronavirus and had a long commute. She goes to Madame Meyer’s home twice a day to help her, prepare her meals, and put her to bed.

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: COVID-19 patients from around Paris are transported to Bordeaux and Poitiers in a specially converted TGV express train, on 10 April.

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: Yves (75) comes to see his wife Josiane (82), who lives in Les Jardins de la Voulzie care home, in Les Ormes-sur-Voulzie, France, while COVID-19 social distancing measures are in force.

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: A morgue employee transports a coffin from the fifth floor of an apartment block, in the Parisian suburb of Pantin.

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: The mother and brother of a 32-year-old man who has died as the result of a coronavirus infection are the only two people permitted at his funeral ceremony, in Pantin, Paris, France.

Title: COVID-19 Pandemic in France
Description: A refrigeration truck is used as a temporary morgue, by a funeral company in Pantin, Paris, France.

Title: COVID-19 First Responder
Description: A doctor stands at the end of her shift, the marks left by a protective mask and goggles clearly visible on her face, in Mexico City, Mexico.

Title: Reborn
Description: Reborn dolls lie set out for ‘adoption’, at a doll fair at the Brentwood Holiday Inn, Brentwood, UK.

Title: Reborn
Description: Kasia is holding her reborn doll, in Warsaw, Poland.

Title: Reborn
Description: Basia changes little Lincoln's clothes, in Olesnica, Poland. Basia's love for reborn dolls began when she saw a documentary, My Fake Baby. Some years later she started to make dolls herself, and the hobby became a business.

Title: Reborn
Description: A reborn doll ‘at home’ in  Olesnica, Poland.

Title: Reborn
Description: A crib set up for Lorcia, a reborn doll, in Gdansk, Poland. Lorcia was part of the family for seven years, as Magdalena could not conceive. When Magdalena gave birth to a baby boy, the doll was stored in a cupboard, its therapeutic purpose fulfilled.

Title: Reborn
Description: Photos of Lorcia, a reborn doll, lie pasted in an album, in Gdansk, Poland. Magdalena loved to dress Lorcia up. Before she gave birth to her son, she used to change the doll's outfit every day and take a photo for her baby album.

Title: Reborn
Description: Mothers take a walk with their children, in  Olesnica. Poland. One of the babies is real and one is a doll.

Title: Reborn
Description: Basia, Dominika, Magda and Emilka go walking, in Karpacz, Poland. A few times a year, the doll lovers gather to spend time together and exchange experiences. Dominika is a teenager who considers herself too young to have children, so adopted a doll to fulfill her strong maternal instinct.

Title: Reborn
Description: A tired child takes a reborn doll’s usual place in a stroller, in Warsaw, Poland.

Title: Reborn
Description: Katarzyna’s four children play at home in Sianozety, Poland. Katarzyna ‘adopted’ a reborn doll after a miscarriage. Her children love the doll, and treat it as part of the family.

Title: Habibi
Description: Nael al-Barghouthi’s suit remains hanging in his bedroom in Kobar, near Ramallah, Palestine. Al-Barghouthi’s wife, Iman Nafi, keeps all her husband’s clothes and belongings in place. Al-Barghouthi was arrested in 1978 after an anti-Israel commando operation. He was released in 2011, married Iman Nafi, but re-arrested in 2014 and sentenced to life imprisonment. He has spent more than 40 years in prison—the longest-serving Palestinian inmate in Israeli jails.

Title: Habibi
Description: Lydia Rimawi lies on her sofa in Beit Rima, near Ramallah, Palestine. Her husband Abdul Karim Rimawi was arrested in 2001 and sentenced to 25 years in prison for involvement in the assassination of Israeli tourism minister Rehavam Ze’evi. The couple have a son, Majd, who was born as a result of IVF in 2013. In 2014, Abdul Karim was fined around US$1,500 for smuggling his semen from prison, and deprived of family visits for two months.

Title: Habibi
Description: A portrait of Atta Abdelgami hangs in his house in Tulkarm, Palestine. Abdelgami is serving a life sentence. He and his wife Rula Ali Ahmed have two children who were conceived using IVF. Portraits are seen not only as mementos of imprisoned men, but also as a means of bringing new generations closer to the resistance.

Title: Habibi
Description: A separation barrier divides the Pisgat Zeev Israeli Settlement (left) from the Shuafat Refugee Camp, near Jerusalem. Palestinians complain of a feeling of being perpetually trapped behind the barrier, as if they lived in a large open-air prison.

Title: Habibi
Description: Wives, mothers, and children of Palestinian prisoners reach a checkpoint in Beit Seira, Palestine. Many face long journeys in order to cross into Israel to visit their relatives in prison. Some have to travel many hours to get to the prison for a 45-minute visit.

Title: Habibi
Description: A chocolate bar conceals a pen case, a favored method of smuggling semen out of prison.

Title: Habibi
Description: Remah Bauod, whose husband is serving four life sentences, lies beside her newborn daughter Racha, conceived following IVF, at the Razan Center for Infertility, in Nablus, Palestine.

Title: Habibi
Description: A baby born a few hours earlier lies inside an incubator at Al-Shifa Hospital, Gaza.

Title: Habibi
Description: Amma Elian, whose husband has been serving a life-sentence since 2003, sits with twins born following IVF, in Tulkarm, Palestine, in January 2015. Initially,. People were reluctant to admit they had had IVF as they were concerned about social and religious disapproval, but in 2017, the Palestinian Supreme Fatwa Council issued an edict permitting the procedure if men were serving long prison sentences.

Title: Habibi
Description: A love letter sent by long-term prisoner Abdul Karim Rimawi to his wife Lydia.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: Protesters demonstrate outside of the burning Minneapolis Police Department 3rd Precinct, in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA. With protesters surrounding the building, firefighters couldn’t reach the station, and it was left to burn through the night.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: Police fire tear gas on demonstrators at the intersection of East Lake Street and Hiawatha Avenue in St Paul, Minnesota, USA, near the precinct station of the officers who arrested George Floyd.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: A protester runs past burning cars and buildings on Chicago Avenue, Saturday, in St Paul, Minnesota, USA. Some 75 fires were reported around the city on 29 and 30 May.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: Police order motorists from their vehicle and to the ground, during a protest on South Washington Avenue, in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: Protesters demonstrate outside of the burning Minneapolis Police Department 3rd Precinct, Thursday, in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA. Surrounding buildings burn after authorities vacated the area before marches converged outside the precinct.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: Protesters raise their fists in defiance outside a burning fast-food restaurant near the precinct station of the officers who arrested Floyd, in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: Protesters and residents watch as police in riot gear walk down a residential street, in St Paul, Minnesota, USA.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: Protesters join arms in defiance during a demonstration outside the burning Minneapolis Police Department 3rd Precinct building, in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: A small group vandalizes a bank building, as mobile demonstrations converge around the Minneapolis Police Department 5th Precinct, in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA.

Title: Minneapolis Unrest: The George Floyd Aftermath
Description: A protester and a National Guardsman face off on East Lake Street, Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA, during a demonstration decrying the death of George Floyd while in Minneapolis Police custody. On 29 May, the National Guard tweeted that they had deployed 500 soldiers to Minneapolis, St Paul, and surrounding communities. Ultimately, 7,123 personnel were called into service, Minnesota National Guard’s largest deployment since the Second World War.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: Demonstrators confront riot police who have formed a blockade to prevent them from reaching the Peruvian Congress building, in Lima, Peru.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: Police form a blockade to prevent protesters from reaching the Peruvian Congress building in Lima, Peru, while the protesters throw paint.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: A demonstrator returns a tear gas bomb fired by the police, during a protest against the new government of interim president Manuel Merino, on Avenida Abancay, Lima, Peru.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: A barrage of fireworks is launched against police trying to prevent protesters from marching on the Peruvian Congress building, in Lima, Peru.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: Demonstrators shelter from tear gas and rubber bullets, behind shields reading ‘Power to the people’, in Lima, Peru.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: People flee tear gas during a protest in front of the Justice Palace in Lima, Peru.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: Supporters of ousted Peruvian president Martin Vizcarra take cover from teargas and rubber bullets behind makeshift shields, during a protest against the government of interim president Manuel Merino, in Lima, Peru.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: A police officer armed with what appears to be a pellet shotgun stands off against protesters, who try to dazzle him with laser beams, in Lima, Peru.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: Demonstrators help an injured fellow protester, during clashes with riot police following a protest against the government of interim president Manuel Merino in Lima, Peru.

Title: Presidential Vacancy
Description: A supporter of ousted president Martin Vizcarra waves a Peruvian flag on Avenida Abancay, in Lima, Peru, in demonstrations that continued past the 11pm curfew imposed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: Firefighters work to put out the fires that engulfed warehouses in Beirut, Lebanon, after a massive explosion in the port. Up to ten firefighters died in the blast.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: An area of Beirut, Lebanon, lies devastated, after a massive explosion in the port. The blast sent a shockwave through the city, damaging buildings and shattering windows.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: An injured man stands near the site of a massive explosion in the port area of Beirut, Lebanon, while firefighters work to put out the fires that engulfed warehouses after the blast.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: A firefighter stands in a devastated area of the port in Beirut, Lebanon, after working to put out the fires that engulfed the warehouses in the port after a massive explosion.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: Men direct a helicopter to drop water on the site of a powerful explosion in the port area of Beirut, Lebanon.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: Protesters clash with security forces in Beirut, Lebanon, following days of anger and mourning after the massive explosion in the port that wrecked large areas of the city. Tens of thousands of demonstrators converged on central Beirut, blaming Lebanese leaders for the blast, and demanding that they be held accountable for years of poor governance and corruption.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: A woman is carried to safety in the devastated Gemmayzeh neighborhood, an historic, predominantly Christian quarter of the city with a high concentration of old buildings. On the first night after the explosion, many cars were unusable and roads were blocked by debris, so injured people had to walk or be moved on foot to safer areas of the city.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: Family members and friends of three firefighters who fought the blaze that engulfed parts of Beirut, Lebanon, after a massive explosion in the port, mourn their loss, in the village of Qartaba, an hour outside of the city. Charbel Karam, Charbel Hitti and Najib Hitti grew up together and became firefighters together. They went missing after rushing to the scene to respond to the initial explosion.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: Abdullah Dalloul walks in the ruins of his former home, which was destroyed by the blast in the port of Beirut, Lebanon. Following the explosion, he and his family squatted in the damaged building with no water or electricity.

Title: Port Explosion in Beirut
Description: Families gather in the evening to observe the extent of the wreckage caused by the blast in the port area of Beirut, Lebanon, from a highway that leads into the city.

Title: Forest Fire
Description: A child sits inside a car close by a forest fire in Oliveira de Frades, Portugal.

Title: Waiting for Release at a Temporary Detention Center in Belarus
Description: Olga Sieviaryniec waits for her husband Paval outside a detention center on Akrestsin Street, Minsk, Belarus.

Title: Emancipation Memorial Debate
Description: A man and woman disagree on the removal of the Emancipation Memorial, in Lincoln Park, Washington DC, USA.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Saeed allows his brother’s prey bird to fly, at home in Gachsaran, Iran. He says he wants to untie it and set it free.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Saeed has the image of a traceur tattooed on his side, with Farsi slang for ‘to be continued’, Gachsaran, Iran.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Saeed enjoys time with friends at Kosar Dam Lake, near Gachsaran, Iran.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Saeed enjoys being hoisted high by a crane, while sitting in a wheelchair, at the Gachsaran Motorcycle Track, Gachsaran, Iran.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Saeed's brother helps him with rehabilitation exercises, Gachsaran, Iran.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Saeed and his wife Maedeh listen to music, surrounded by photographs of Saeed’s past feats, Gachsaran, Iran.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Maedeh and Saeed are pictured on their wedding day, in Gachsaran, Iran. Maedeh is a motorcyclist, and met Saeed when he was her parkour mentor.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Saeed and Maedeh give their consent, during their wedding ceremony, in Gachsaran, Iran. The couple finally were married after years of opposition from both their families.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Saeed and his wife Maedeh return home after watching motocross training at the Gachsaran Motorcycle track, Gachsaran, Iran, where they spend most of their free time. Maedeh is a motorcyclist.

Title: Thoughts of Flight
Description: Saeed relaxes in Kosar Dam Lake, near Gachsaran, Iran. He managed to stay in the water unassisted for 15 minutes.

Title: Faces of Bridge
Description: A competition in the Borlänge Bridge Club clubhouse takes around three hours, Borlänge, Sweden.

Title: Faces of Bridge
Description: Making bridge work without talking to each other is a challenge that requires a lot of thinking, Borlänge, Sweden.

Title: Faces of Bridge
Description: At the start of each game, everyone is required to check that they have 13 cards, Borlänge, Sweden.

Title: Faces of Bridge
Description: It is usually completely quiet at the card tables. Facial expressions and body language are all that signal how a game is going, Borlänge, Sweden.

Title: Faces of Bridge
Description: Plexiglass screens permitted games to go ahead at the Borlänge Bridge Club, Borlänge, Sweden, despite COVID-19 restrictions.

Title: Faces of Bridge
Description: An 11-year-old boy plays a 92-year-old man, at the Borlänge Bridge Club, Borlänge, Sweden.

Title: Faces of Bridge
Description: A little under half of club members at the Borlänge Bridge Club, Borlänge, Sweden, are women.

Title: Faces of Bridge
Description: Even if the emotions are not as intense as in some other sports, Bridge is a competition and the emotion is always there, Borlänge, Sweden.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Flint Jaguars player Dana Homes high-fives one of his coaches as he leaves the locker room for warm-up, in Flint, Michigan, USA.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: A basketball net supported by cinder blocks stands beside a street in Flint, Michigan, USA. The board reads ‘FDT’, an acronym based on a popular anti-Donald Trump protest song.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Jaguars junior Dion Brown sits with his girlfriend Lakenya Thomas as they watch a junior varsity game in a nearly empty gym, in Flint, Michigan, USA.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Jaguars player Dana Homes cleans snow off his parents’ car after basketball practice, in Flint, Michigan, USA, before going to pick up a teammate to watch the National Basketball Association all-star game.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Jaguars star player Taevion Rushing cuts to the basket for a layup, at a game between the Flint Jaguars and the Bentley Bulldogs from Burton, Michigan, at Flint Southwestern High in Flint, Michigan, USA.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Jaguars player D'Angelo Mays plays with a basketball in his bedroom at home, in Flint, Michigan, USA.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: The gym at former basketball powerhouse Flint Central High School, in Flint, Michigan, USA, stands derelict, eight years after the school permanently closed. The American flag and the team banners, both covered in mold, can still be seen in the rafters.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Flint basketball legend Charlie Bell shows off his ‘Flint’ tattoo outside his old high school, Flint Southwesternin Flint, Michigan, USA. Bell was one of the three ‘Flintstones’, who helped lead the Michigan State Spartans to a national championship in 2000. He has returned to Flint to coach a local semi-professional team.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Taevion Rushing sits at home with his grandparents in Flint, Michigan, USA. Tae spends hours arguing with his grandfather about basketball. His grandparents are keen basketball fans and always have constructive critique for Tae after his games.

Title: Those Who Stay Will Be Champions
Description: Flint Jaguars team star Taevion Rushing jumps from one locker to another in the team locker room, in Flint, Michigan, USA, before the last regular season game of his high school basketball career. He aims to go on to play basketball at a junior college.

Title: Tour of Poland Cycling Crash
Description: Dutch cyclist, Dylan Groenewegen (left), crashes meters before the finish line, after colliding with fellow countryman Fabio Jakobsen during the first stage of the Tour of Poland, in Katowice, Poland.

Title: Home Training
Description: Masters athlete Pat Naughton (87) trains at his home in Nenagh, County Tipperary, Ireland, while under COVID-19 lockdown restrictions.

Title: Emancipation Memorial Debate
Description: A man and woman disagree on the removal of the Emancipation Memorial, in Lincoln Park, Washington DC, USA.
Prize Level: World Press Photo of the Year Nominee

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Piotr, Jurek and Tomek participate in an exercise simulating an air pollution emergency, at a summer military camp in Mrzeżyno, Poland.

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Wojtek practices camouflage at a summer military camp in Mrzeżyno, Poland.

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Karol plays an injured person in an exercise simulating the military overcoming terrorists who had occupied a house, at a summer camp in Mrzeżyno, Poland.

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Mateusz practices swimming with a weapon, at a summer military camp in Mrzeżyno, Poland.

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Pawel distributes weapons during an exercise simulating the military overcoming terrorists who had occupied a house, at a summer military camp in Mrzeżyno, Poland.

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Ola is a student at the Liceum Wojskowo-Policyjne, a military and police high school in Złotoryi, Poland.

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Karol plays an injured person in an exercise simulating the military overcoming terrorists who had occupied a house, at a summer camp in Mrzeżyno, Poland.

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Piotr and Tomek take part in an exercise on dealing with chemical weapons, at a summer camp in Mrzeżyno, Poland.

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Robert rests in his newly built shelter during an activity at a weekend military club in Żuławka Forest in Gdańsk, Poland.

Title: Niewybuch
Description: Adrian takes a break during an exercise, at a summer military camp in Mrzeżyno, Poland.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: A young refugee gazes over a border fence separating Greece from Macedonia, at the northern Greek border station of Idomeni.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: Most of these graves of people who drowned while attempting to make the crossing fromTurkey to Lesbos remain unidentified, in Lesbos, Greece. According to the International Organization for Migration, more than 3,770 migrants died trying to cross the Mediterranean in 2015.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: People face a cloud of smoke in clashes with police near a refugee camp in the village of Diavata near Thessaloniki, Greece.Trouble flared outside the camp on 4 April, after a social media rumour suggested onward travel restrictions had been lifted. Some 500 migrants announced their intention to march to the border with northern Macedonia, some 60 kilometers away, and on to Central Europe.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: A woman holds her baby as she sits inside a tent during rainfall, at a makeshift camp on the Greek-Macedonian border, near the village of Idomeni, Greece.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: Thousands of discarded life jackets, used by refugees while crossing the Aegean Sea from Turkey to the island of Lesbos, lie beside the road near the town of Molyvos, Lesbos, Greece.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: A man stands in front of a fence erected at the Greek-Macedonian border to prevent migrants from crossing into Macedonia, near the village of Idomeni, Greece.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: A newly erected gate blocks the railway line at the Greek-Macedonian border, near the Idomeni refugee camp in Greece, shortly after Macedonia closed its borders to all but Syrian and Iraqi refugees.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: A man sits inside his tent at Anagnostopoulou, a temporary camp for refugees in Oraiokastro, a suburb of Thessaloniki, in northern Greece.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: Children play with a plastic bag at a camp for refugees and migrants in Schisto, near Athens, Greece.

Title: Trapped in Greece
Description: A man stands outside his tent at the former Anagnostopoulou military camp, which is being used as a temporary camp for refugees and migrants, in Oraiokastro, Thessaloniki, Greece.

Title: Rescue of Giraffes from Flooding Island
Description: A Rothschild’s giraffe (Giraffa camelopardalis rothschildi) is transported to safety in a custom-built barge from a flooded Longicharo Island, Lake Baringo, in western Kenya.

Title: Path of the Panther
Description: A female Florida panther creeps through a fence between Audubon’s Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary and an adjacent cattle ranch, in Naples, Florida, USA. Her kitten trails behind her.

Title: Log Pile Bouldering
Description: Georg climbs a log pile while training for bouldering, in Kochel am See, Bavaria, Germany.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: Dollie comes in to land on the balcony door, where she uses the higher vantage point to check out if the coast is clear before entering the kitchen, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: Maaike, the photographer’s wife, sits on the apartment balcony—on the chair under which the pigeons nested the year before, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: The photographer’s daughter Merel cowers after Dollie flies past and perches on the balcony, before entering the house, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: Ollie perches on a dirty plate as the photographer fills the dishwasher, while Dollie looks on from outside, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: Dollie feasts on dinner leftovers in the kitchen, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: Dollie struggles to keep her balance as she lands on the radiator, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: Ollie, standing behind six-year-old Fleur, joins the family for sushi takeout—an at-home wedding anniversary celebration because restaurants are still closed, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: Ollie walks through the hallway, which, a month into the lockdown, has not seen any human visitors for a while, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: Ollie flies through the living room, after knocking over toys, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: Pandemic Pigeons—A Love Story
Description: Merel looks at Ollie, shut outside in the rain, in Vlaardingen, the Netherlands.

Title: New Life
Description: The eggs of a Wiley’s glass frog, Nymphargus wileyi, hang on the tip of a leaf in Tropical Andean cloud forest, near the Yanayacu Biological Station, Napo, Ecuador.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: A farmer examines desert locusts at an infested farm in Nakukulas, Turkana County, Kenya.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: Bands of juvenile locusts (hoppers) infest a grazing area in Nakukulas, Turkana County, Kenya.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: A truck with a worker on the top of the trailer drives through a massive swarm of locusts, near Archers Post, Samburu County.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: Henry Lenayasa, chief of the settlement of Archers Post, in Samburu County, Kenya, tries to scare away a massive swarm of locusts ravaging grazing area.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: A massive swarm of locusts devours foliage on trees, near Archers Post, Samburu County, Kenya.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: A member of Kenya’s National Youth Service (NYS) sprays pesticides in an area infested with hopper bands of desert locusts, near Lokichar, Turkana County, Kenya. In February 2020, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) began training 300 NYS members to assist in the Kenyan government's ground surveillance of desert locusts.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: A desert locust belonging to a massive swarm sits on a tree branch in a remote grazing area, near Archers Post, Samburu County, Kenya.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: Turkana farmer Lochom Ekiru (65) assesses the damage of his maize crops, after swarms of desert locusts ravaged them, in Kalemngorok, Turkana County, Kenya.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: A motorcyclist in a face mask rides through a locust swarm, near Archers Post, Samburu County, Kenya.

Title: Locust Invasion in East Africa
Description: Lisa, Chris and Celine, three young pastoralists taking care of their families’ cattle, watch a swarm of locusts in a grazing area near Archers Post, Samburu County, Kenya.

Title: The Transition: Ignat
Description: Ignat, a transgender man, sits with his girlfriend Maria in Saint Petersburg, Russia.

Title: In Flight
Description: A father teaches his autistic daughter, Ksenia (10), to launch a toy plane in Moscow, Russia.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Torrell Jasper (35) poses with his firearms in the backyard of his house in Schriever, Louisiana, USA. A former US Marine, he learned to shoot from his father as a child.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Eric Arnsberger (30) and  Morgan Gagnier (22) pose with their firearms in their bedroom in Lake Forest, California, USA. Eric never goes out unarmed. He has served in the army, worked as a policeman, and now teaches people how to handle guns and shoot safely. Morgan is a trainer in a gym. She fell in love with Eric through following him on Instagram.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Robert Baldwin Jr stands in his secret gunroom, behind a one-way mirror in his home in Las Vegas, Nevada, USA. His girlfriend, Tori, sits at the table. Robert received his first gun—a .22-caliber rifle—as a gift from his father when he was six.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Brandon Brown stands with his children Ashtan (5) and Carson (3) and his weapons in front of his home in Harvest, Alabama, USA. Brandon works as a government analyst, just outside the town where he was born and raised. He shot for the first time when he was 12, and bought an AK-47 as soon as he turned 18.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Charlie Ferer with some of his firearms outside his house in Paradise Valley, Arizona, USA. After training as an economist, he ran a business making artificial grass, then in 2012 founded a company that manufactures munitions and provides training and intelligence solutions to US and non-US government clients.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Danyela D’Angelo sits with a collection of firearms in a vault in Arizona, USA. The collection comprises hundreds of firearms, historic Second World War pieces, weapons of war, and prototypes. It forms part of a trust held in her name until she comes of age. Danyela learned to shoot from her father when she was 12, and since then has competed in shooting events across the US, firing around 3,000 rounds a month.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Avery Skipalis (33) stands with her firearms in front of her house in Tampa, Florida, USA. Her son looks on from a window. Avery joined the US Air Force when she was 17, and after serving in the UAE, Japan and Germany, left to start a company that offers firearms safety classes to adults and children.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Bree Michael Warner (43) poses with her firearms in her bedroom in Putnam Valley, New York, USA. Bree worked as an actress and TV-show host in California, where she became a National Rifle Association member and a firearms instructor. Now living in New York, she teaches women how to shoot, both for self-defense and as a pastime.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Parker ‘Baret’ Fawbush stands with his family and his firearms, in the backyard of the church where he works as the pastor, in Poseyville, Indiana, USA. Baret (as he prefers to be known) also works as a shooting instructor, and his social media accounts, where he reviews different firearms and teaches people how to use them, have large followings.

Title: The ‘Ameriguns’
Description: Will Renke (35) stands with most of his firearms arranged in the shape of the USA, in the backyard of his home in South Carolina. Will fired his first weapon—a  Fox Savage .410 shotgun, which he now keeps carefully preserved— when he was 10, and now buys a new firearm every two weeks.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: Raindrops symbolize the splashing water and storms in migrants’ stories, Livorno, Italy. The photographer also sees them as a metaphor for stars flung out into space as the result of the collision of two black holes, and as representing the unknown: a place both attractive and terrifying, holding hope as well as nightmares.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: Christ was born in Gabon and came to Italy to study economy at university, in Florence, Italy.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: Dora, from Gabon, sits in a room in Livorno, Italy. She came to Italy to study design and wants to go back to Africa once she's finished with her studies, because she likes living there more than in Europe.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: A wave on the coast of Italy, at Livorno, taken in red light. The sea  features strongly in migrants’  dreams and stories, and red is seen as a primordial color representing blood and danger, but also energy.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: Angel (right) and Gaia are school friends from Livorno, Italy. Both are of Nigerian origin. Angel was born in Italy, shortly after her parents moved there, as her father was setting up a wine business; Gaia came with her parents two years ago, as they wanted her to go to an Italian school.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: Roena came from Gabon to study in Italy, and lives in Florence.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: Blessing came to Italy from Nigeria, and works in Livorno, Italy, as a childminder. She is married and has a child of her own.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: The photographer shot this landscape at Buca delle Fate, a tiny inlet in the Maremma coast, Italy, in response to colorful visions described by Blessing, who came to Italy from Nigeria and works as a childminder. Night traveling, and hiding and waiting in the forested regions are very present in the migrants’ stories.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: Mahamadou is half-Senegalese, half-Gambian and fled his country as a refugee after taking part in a university demonstration. He lives and works around Florence, Italy, on a long-term contract.

Title: Nowhere Near
Description: Steve Kevin (who prefers to use the name Clayton) dances at the seaside in Castiglioncello, Tuscany, Italy. He came to Italy from Cameroon to study, and is setting up a dance school to teach traditional African dance.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: Trees stand covered in volcanic ash, near Taal Volcano, Batangas, Philippines.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: A resident of Talisay in Batangas washes down a car, which is covered in volcanic ash mixed with rain, as Taal Volcano erupts, Batangas, Philippines.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: Lightning strikes and a column of ash surrounds the crater of Taal Volcano as it erupts, Batangas, Philippines.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: Residents of the town of Talisay in Batangas, Philippines, use plastic bags to shield themselves from ash mixed with rainwater, as the volcano erupts.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: Residents return to their homes covered in volcanic ash from Taal Volcano's eruption in Talisay, Batangas, Philippines. Officials highly advised against residents returning to their homes at the time, as the volcano was still very active.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: Motorcyclists cross a bridge partially blocked by ash-laden trees after the Taal Volcano eruption, in the municipality of Laurel, in Batangas, Philippines.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: The carcass of a cow floats inshore near houses wrecked by the eruption of Taal Volcano, on Luzon Island, Batangas, Philippines.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: A resident of Laurel, who returned home briefly to retrieve belongings, carries religious figurines, in Batangas, Philippines. Officials highly advised against residents returning to their homes at the time, as the volcano was still very active.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: Residents of the municipality of Laurel, in Batangas, Philippines, clean rooftops of volcanic ash after the eruption of Taal Volcano.

Title: Taal Volcano Eruption
Description: A house lies buried in volcanic ash from the eruption of Taal Volcano, on Luzon Island, Batangas, Philippines.
